solution_line_template: Since {meters_per_kilometer} kilometer is equal to {meters_per_kilometer} meters, then {kilometers_run} kilometers is {kilometers_run} x {meters_per_kilometer} = <<{kilometers_run}*{meters_per_kilometer}={distance_meters}>>{distance_meters} meters.
Since an hour has {minutes_per_hour} minutes, then {hours_run} hours is equal to {hours_run} x {minutes_per_hour} = <<{hours_run}*{minutes_per_hour}={time_minutes}>>{time_minutes} minutes.
Therefore, her speed is {distance_meters} meters/{time_minutes} hours = <<{distance_meters}/{time_minutes}={speed_meters_per_minute}>>{speed_meters_per_minute} meters per minute.
